theoryTitle: Chopper's Devil Fruit is Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Bigfoot
theoryText: Fans theorize that Chopper's Devil Fruit is actually the mythical Zoan-type Hito Hito no Mi, Model: Bigfoot, rather than the standard Human model. The key evidence includes: (1) In none of Chopper's full transformations does he become a full human - he always has his signature blue nose and a furry coat, unlike other Zoan users who fully transform; (2) Bigfoot is described as a legendary giant creature with human attributes but covered in thick fur like animals in cold regions, which matches Chopper perfectly; (3) This would explain why Chopper was born with a blue nose - it wasn't a natural mutation, but a sign he was destined for this specific mythical fruit. This theory gained traction after the revelation about Luffy's true Devil Fruit being a mythical model rather than standard.
author: Multiple One Piece fans and theorists
spoilerScope: Discusses potential future revelations about Chopper's Devil Fruit similar to Luffy's reveal
supportingEvidence: Chopper never fully transforms into a complete human without any reindeer features
His blue nose remains in all transformation forms
Bigfoot mythology matches Chopper's appearance and cold-region adaptation
Precedent set by Luffy's fruit actually being mythical model
Chopper's monster point could be the true mythical form
counterEvidence: Officially stated as standard Hito Hito no Mi in databooks
Would diminish the theme of Chopper being rejected for being 'normal' different
Blue nose explained as natural mutation in backstory

theoryTitle: Hiriluk's Cherry Blossoms Connect to God Valley
theoryText: Dr. Hiriluk mentioned being miraculously cured of a deadly disease by cherry blossoms on a mountain in 'a faraway land in the West'. Chapter 1095 later confirmed that God Valley was in the West Blue. Fans theorize that Hiriluk witnessed the cherry blossoms on God Valley before it disappeared, and this experience is what inspired his dream to cure Drum Kingdom's 'frozen heart' with cherry blossoms. This could connect Hiriluk's backstory to one of the series' greatest mysteries and explain the profound impact those cherry blossoms had on him. The theory suggests that whatever happened on God Valley - possibly the liberation or revolution that occurred there - is symbolically connected to Hiriluk's philosophy about curing people's hearts.
author: Various One Piece theorists on Worstgen and Reddit
spoilerScope: Connects to major late-series revelations about God Valley and the Void Century
supportingEvidence: Hiriluk specifically said the land was 'in the West' and God Valley is confirmed to be in West Blue
The mysterious disappearance of God Valley could explain why Hiriluk couldn't return
Cherry blossoms theme connects to Revolutionary Army and liberation symbolism
Dragon and the Revolutionary Army are introduced in a chapter titled 'Skull and Cherry Blossoms'
Timeline could align with Hiriluk's age and backstory
counterEvidence: Could be coincidental thematic connection rather than literal plot connection
Many places in West Blue could have cherry blossoms
Hiriluk's story works without this connection

theoryTitle: Chopper's Blue Nose Signifies D Clan Connection
theoryText: Some fans theorize that Chopper's blue nose, which caused him to be rejected and is explicitly unusual even for reindeer, might signify some connection to the Will of D or a deeper destiny in the One Piece world. The theory points to how cherry blossoms (sakura) are symbolically connected to the 'D' clan throughout the series, and Chopper's entire arc revolves around cherry blossoms through Hiriluk's legacy. The unusual blue nose that marked him as 'special' from birth, combined with his eventual role as the doctor who will help Luffy achieve his dream, suggests he may have a greater destiny than being a random reindeer who ate a Devil Fruit. This is supported by the symbolic and esoteric analysis of Volume 17, which heavily features cherry blossom and 'D' symbolism.
author: Antiel.ARt and various One Piece theorists
spoilerScope: Discusses potential connections to Will of D and series-wide mysteries
supportingEvidence: Cherry blossom symbolism is heavily associated with D clan members
Chopper's blue nose was unusual from birth, suggesting destiny
Volume 17 (Drum Island) contains heavy D and cherry blossom symbolism
Chopper's dream to 'cure any disease' could be metaphorically about curing the world
He's the only Straw Hat with an unexplained birth abnormality
counterEvidence: Chopper is explicitly a reindeer, not human, so D inheritance makes no biological sense
Blue nose is explained as natural mutation that caused rejection
No foreshadowing or hints from Oda about this connection
Thematic connection doesn't require literal bloodline connection
